p: Distortions of the oxygen octahedral framework from an ideal configuration were characterized by introducing a set of deformation modes for the oxygen octahedra. For a more intuitive interpretation, the modes were selected to mimic both typical lattice distortions (e.g., tetragonal, orthorhombic) and vibrational modes (rotations, bending) while providing a complete orthonormal basis. The resulting modes are depicted in Supplementary Fig. 15, whereas their corresponding coordinate-transformation matrices for cubic symmetry are summarized in Supplementary Table 1. All the modes, except for the tetragonal, preserve an octahedron’s volume. The orthorhombic and rotational modes describe oxygen coordinates adequately within the limits of the small-angle (linear) approximation.
